meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by the belief in only one God.
meanings.sent1: The monotheistical teachings of the church emphasize the worship of a single deity.
meanings.sent2: Her monotheistical faith guided her moral decisions throughout her life.
meanings.sent3: The monotheistical nature of the religion made it easy for followers to focus their prayers.
meanings.sent4: In a world of many gods, his monotheistical beliefs stood out like a beacon of truth.
meanings.sent5: The monotheistical doctrine was so ingrained in their culture that it shaped every aspect of their lives.

meanings.sent1: The monotheistical scriptures provided guidance on how to live a righteous life.
meanings.sent2: Monotheistical practices involve the worship of a single divine being.
meanings.sent3: She found humor in the monotheistical rituals, finding peace in their simplicity.
meanings.sent4: The monotheistical symbolism in the artwork spoke volumes about the artist's beliefs.
meanings.sent5: The monotheistical traditions were passed down from generation to generation, preserving their faith.
